title: Kerry Katona is SLAMMED by followers as she promotes cosmetic enhancements 'special package' deal
text:
Kerry Katona has never been shy about flaunting her cosmetically-enhanced wares.

And on Thursday the reality star, 39, revealed that the company responsible for her latest round of treatment is naming a package deal after her.

But this was met with a major backlash from her fans, who took to the comments under the post to insist it was very expensive, sending a negative message to her young followers and note that she was likely gifted her treatments, rather than having to pay for it.

Special offer? Kerry Katona has revealed that the company responsible for her latest round of cosmetic treatments is naming a package deal after her

Taking to Instagram she posted the offer, alongside the caption: 'I’ve had so many positive and kind comments about my recent treatment with Harley Cosmetic London that they’ve put together a special package offer for my followers!'

The ad showed a picture of Kerry (albeit with the top half of her head cropped off) along with the offer of '2ml face filler and 1 area of fat dissolving £699'.

Comments began rolling in from her followers, with one posting: 'What bulls**t!!!! You got it free!'

Another ranted: 'Not great for some of your younger audiences or fans really......!'

Didn't go down well: But this was met with a major backlash from her fans, who took to the comments under the post to insist it was very expensive, sending a negative message to her young followers and note that she was likely gifted her enhancements, rather than having to pay for it

Someone else posted: 'Ordinary workers cant afford this Kerry!'

'That’s REALLY expensive. Lots of places are much cheaper than that for the same results!' someone else posted.

'What an absolute disappointment! Didn't think you would promote this in such an unethical way! By all means do what you need to do to make yourself feel good, but please bare in mind the bad influence you promote to your younger followers,' penned another fan.

Followed by someone else who penned: 'Usually love your posts and I've followed you for years but I'm actually shocked that u are promoting this. Why are u not telling people that follow you that there natural beauty is enough and that they don't need to spend a fortune or go under the knife to feel better about themselves?'

A rep for Kerry has been approached for comment.

Makeover: Kerry recently showed off the results of her newly applied lip and chin fillers. The star is pictured right before at an event at the end of September

Filler: Kerry shared a video of herself getting filler injections in the comfort of her own home

This promotion comes days after Kerry was admitted to A&E for unknown reasons - not long after sharing a video of herself getting filler injections in the comfort of her own home.

She added a caption: 'So today I had the beautiful ladies from @harleycosmeticlondon come and enhance my natural beauty.

'Now I know half of you are gonna have a go and say something like me being a role model blah blah but I honestly don’t think this is any different to heavy make up if it’s done properly!!

'I’m 40 next year and just had a full M.O.T on me face!!! And I’m loving the results.. thank you ladies.'

The star confirmed she had reunited with her personal trainer former beau Ryan Mahoney in her column for new! magazine in September.

In the zone: Kerry appeared to be anticipating the pain as she closed her eyes while the injections were administered

Happy with the results: Kerry added a thrilled caption the photos in which she stated she didn't care about any 'role model' backlash because she was 'loving the results'

She branded the hunk a 'godsend' as he supports her following the death of her ex-husband George Kay.

She said: 'He's been a good friend to me and over the last few months we just decided to give it a go.

'He's been a godsend recently when I've needed him most. We're settled, committed, my kids love him and so do I.'

Kerry added that she and Ryan were hoping to keep their relationship out of the spotlight, after a string of relationships ended once she spoke too openly about them.

She said: 'In my mind, the definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over and expecting a different result. So this time I'm finally dating a man who has a job, his own money, and is very happy to stay out of the media.'

'DJ and I would be dead if I'd stayed with George Kay': Tearful Kerry told Loose Women on Wednesday about the horrific abuse by her late husband who passed away in July

Worries: Kerry said DJ started spitting in her face after seeing George do the same thing, but she still felt guilty that he did not see her for a year before he died due to his drug use

Kerry broke down in tears on Wednesday's episode of Loose Women when she discussed her estranged husband George's death in her first TV interview since it happened.

She claimed he would have killed either her or daughter DJ, five, if she had stayed with him and said their daughter had started spitting in her face as she copied her troubled father.

George passed away on July 6 aged 39 died after eating cocaine at a Holiday Inn after police had visited him just 12 hours earlier.

He was said to have been 'acting erratically' the night before he died and when hotel staff checked on him at 10am the next morning, they found him 'eating a large amount of suspected cocaine'.

Tragic: George, 39, reportedly died after eating 'a quantity of cocaine' at the Holiday Inn hotel in Sutton Weaver, Runcorn, Cheshire (pictured in 2013)

The police and the North West Ambulance service were called, with George being taken to Warrington General Hospital for treatment, where he died.

Kerry said that her family are coping and said: 'The kids are doing really well. It was the hardest conversation I've ever had to have with a five-year-old, [DJ]

Recounting a conversation with her agent when they called her, she said: 'You’re calling to tell me George is dead aren’t you?'

'There was four months where he could have taken me to court and tried to see DJ.

'I rang home and asked Lily to lock the door. I told Ryan they're ringing to tell me George's dead. It was accidental overdose. He didn't kill himself, he was too vain.'

Kerry touched upon the domestic violence she claims to have suffered while she was with George.

'When I got a good hiding, I'd apologise to him': Kerry spoke about being groomed by George throughout their relationship

She said: 'George had very many issues. By the time I’d worked all these issues out, I was already madly in love with him, we had a baby on the way.

'We've known each other since we were 14. I always fancied him. He always fancied me - and when the violence started it’s like you're being groomed. Everyone tells you to walk away but you can't.

'When I got a good hiding, I'd apologise to him.'

'I feel guilty that DJ didn't get to see her dad for a year, I really do. I'm not slagging him off, I would hand DJ over and I'd fear I wouldn't get her back.

Children: Kerry is a doting mother to five - she has two daughters with ex Westlife partner Brian McFadden Molly, 16, and Lilly-Sue, 14. She also shares Heidi, 10, and Maxwell, nine, with second husband Mark Croft (pictured in May 2017)

Kerry said she had to end things with George for the sake of her children. She said: 'Any decent mother, you would not allow your child to be around somebody who was abusing drugs'

'He would spit in my face, and then DJ started to spit in my face.

Kerry added: 'I know if I’d stayed with George I’d be dead. I know it 100%. Or DJ would. I’m going to stand by that until the day I die. It was never going to happen [him change his life].'

Kerry said she had to end things with George for the sake of her children.

She said: 'Any decent mother, you would not allow your child to be around somebody who was abusing drugs.

Kerry broke down as she said: 'I know if I’d stayed with George I’d be dead. I know it 100%. Or DJ would. I’m going to stand by that until the day I die'

Being blamed: Kerry said: 'I got lots of stuff in social media, "I've got blood on my hands", I left George and I will not be blamed for his death'

'When I was in my dark days doing drugs, if I didn’t sort myself out, I wouldn’t have my children and I wouldn’t blame anyone for taking my children off me. I wanted to help him.'

She said the moment she realised she had to leave was at her friend's dad's funeral.

She said: 'George was with me and I just thought how do I want my life to end. I had this fear, it’ll be my funeral next.'

'I remember going up to Danielle [Brown] and I said I didn't love George anymore. I really fancied him.

'But when I was supposed to go into Big Brother he said, "if you leave those kids with me watch what happens..."

'Molly looked at me like I was a weak person and I decided I never wanted to look at me like that again.'

Cheshire Police's statement in full... A spokesman for Cheshire Police said: 'At 9.54pm on Friday, July 5, police received a report of concern for the safety of a 39-year-old man at a hotel on Wood Lane, Sutton Weaver. 'Officers attended and spoke to the man, as well as hotel staff. All parties agreed that he could remain at the hotel. 'At 10.11am on Saturday, July 6, police received a further report of concern for the man's safety. 'Due to the information provided the caller was advised to contact North West Ambulance Service for assistance. 'Paramedics attended the hotel and the man was taken to Warrington General Hospital for treatment, where he sadly later died. 'The death is not being treated as suspicious and a file will be prepared for the coroner. 'As with any death following police contact, Cheshire Constabulary has referred the matter to the Independent Office for Police Conduct.'

Despite being estranged, Kerry and George were still married at the time of his death.

She said: 'I went to the chapel rest and I drove straight down because we were still married. I was so angry that he left his baby girl, because she's beautiful.

Kerry continued: “I’m so angry. He gave me hell when he was alive, and then he just left me, not left me, he left this world. I’m not going to lie, he’s better off where he is.

'He was so unhappy on this earth. He had so many demons, so many issues, we thought when DJ was born he’d change his ways, he had chance after chance.

'He was never going to change, never going to change.'

Of him choosing drugs over her she said: 'That’s why I’m so angry. Makes you feel worthless. I got lots of stuff in social media, "I've got blood on my hands", I left George and I will not be blamed for his death.'

Supporting her: Kerry was joined by (L-R) Coleen Nolan, Stacey Solomon, Janet Street-Porter and Gloria Hunniford

Katona married Kay in September 2014, months after giving birth to Dylan-Jorge however the couple divorced in 2017.

There had reportedly been a restraining order issued keeping George away from Katona at the time of his death.

Kay and Katona initially met during their teenage years at at Padgate High School in Warrington where they were childhood sweethearts.

The former couple rekindled their romance during their thirties while Katona was on her book tour for Too Much Too Young and Kay worked as her security guard.

During their three-year marriage Kay battled mental health issues and Katona later claimed that he had been violent towards her throughout their relationship.

She previously split from him in October 2015 after thirteen months together and a month later appeared in court accusing him of beating her up at their home, after allegedly arming himself with a Taser-style device and a knife.

Gratitude: Kerry later took to Instagram to thank Loose Women for letting her talk about her experience in a sensitive fashion

However he was later acquitted after prosecutors revealed that they didn't have enough evidence to secure a conviction.

A matter of months later, the pair first sparked reconciliation rumours when they were spotted out together with their daughter Dylan-Jorge.

The couple were so determined to make their relationship work and appeared on the reality show In Therapy to talk through their issues and even blissfully renewed their wedding vows in November 2016.

Kerry is a doting mother to five - she has two daughters with ex Westlife partner Brian McFadden Molly, 16, and Lilly-Sue, 14.

She also shares Heidi, 10, and Maxwell, nine, with second husband Mark Croft.

description: Kerry Katona has revealed that the company responsible for her latest round of cosmetic treatment is naming a package deal after her.
